bill.title: TANF assistance benefits; require applicants to submit to drug testing to qualify.
bill.description: An Act Relating To Drug Screening Of Potential And Existing Beneficiaries Of Temporary Assistance For Needy Families; To Require The Department Of Human Services To Perform A Drug Test On An Applicant For Temporary Assistance For Needy Families Benefits; To Require Such Individual To Bear The Cost Of The Drug Test; To Require The Department To Provide, And The Applicant To Acknowledge Receipt Of, Notice Of The Drug-screening Policy; To Require The Department To Increase The Amount Of The Initial Tanf Benefit By The Amount Paid By The Individual For The Drug Testing; To Provide Procedures For Testing And Retesting; To Require The Department To Provide Information Concerning Local Substance Abuse Treatment Programs To An Individual Who Tests Positive; To Provide Conditions For An Individual To Reapply For Temporary Assistance For Needy Families Benefits; To Provide That, If A Parent Is Ineligible As A Result Of Failing A Drug Test, The Eligibility Of The Children Is Not Affected; To Provide Conditions For Designating Another Protective Payee; To Provide Rulemaking Authority To The Department; And To Amend Section 43-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformanity; And For Related Purposes.

step.action: Referred To Public Health and Welfare
